p: The Bayesian skyline plot of Indian strains from 1963 to 2017 was generated for the product of effective population size and generation time (Ne τ) vs. time ( Fig. 5) [ 30]. The plot showed almost a constant phase of CHIKV infection till 2000 and then a slight decrease. Following this, a sudden increase in the virus population was attributed to the 2004–09 epidemics. Subsequently, almost stable virus population was reported during 2010–2017.
